Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the promise made in the stimulus bill to keep unemployment under 8%, as there is no evidence of anyone in the administration making such a public pledge.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence to back up the assertion that the stimulus bill promised to keep unemployment under 8%.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the stimulus bill made a specific promise to keep unemployment under 8%, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the stimulus bill aimed to reduce unemployment but did not make a specific promise to keep it under 8%.
